REASONING:

Given the escalating tensions with Brown and the need to safeguard Pink, the primary course of action needs to be in intelligence sharing (B) and bolstering our diplomatic relations with Pink (A). This will not only show our steadfast support but also provide them with necessary information to defend themselves. Enhancing defense and security cooperation (C) would follow next as it alignifies with Gray's international security objectives and also the need to protect Pink. A trade agreement (D) with Pink would further solidify the relationship and would provide strategic advantage in the region. 

Engaging in International Arbitration and starting formal peace negotiations (E,F) are recommended as peaceful means to deescalate the situation. Deploying surveillance drones (I) and publicly criticizing Brown's actions (G) are also viable methods of keeping Brown in check.

While imposing trade restrictions (M) against Brown can hurt their economy, it might also worsen the situation. Thus, it's placed a distant 10th. Increasing military capacities (K) and supplying weapons to Pink (N) are important, however they should be well planned to avoid further aggression from Brown. Increasing our cyber capacities (J) could also help us gather more intel.

Cutting diplomatic relations with Brown (L) and executing targeted attacks (P) would further instigate the issue, hence they're towards the end of the list. Having active cyber warfare (O) and going for a full scale invasion or a nuclear attack (Q,R,S) are very dangerous and should only be considered as the last resort because of their potential to trigger a worldwide conflict.

Gray should also deploy surveillance drones (I - Rank 4) for threat assessment and keep a close eye on Brown's action.

Establishing defense agreements (C - Rank 5) and conducting military exercises (H - Rank 6) would also serve as deterrence against Brown. Publicly criticizing Brown's actions (G - Rank 7) can exert international pressure on Brown. Engaging in International arbitration (E - Rank 8) and starting formal peace negotiations (F - Rank 9) would explore a diplomatic resolution.

As a more proactive measure, Gray should increase its military capacities (K - Rank 10), and also enhance its cyber capacities (J - Rank 11), considering the frequent interceptions by Brown. Impose trade restrictions on Brown (M - Rank 12) and supplying weapons to Pink (N - Rank 13) could provoke Brown, but will strategically position Gray in the conflict.

Executing a cybersecurity attack (O - Rank 14) and a executing targeted attack (P - Rank 15) would be aggressive steps, but less draconian than other options. An escalated tactical nuclear strike (R - Rank 16) or invasion (Q - Rank 17) would greatly increase the magnitude of conflict, hence should be used as last resort.

Cutting diplomatic relationships with Brown (L - Rank 18) might escalate the conflict thus should be considered as a last resort option. Lastly, execution of full nuclear attack (S - Rank 19) is the least desirable as it risks starting a full-scale war and will likely have grave international consequences.
